授業目的:
This course focuses on brand management and corporate communications, integral management functions which help to build and sustain relationships with various stakeholder groups related to corporate survival in the U.S.
One of the important themes will be a cross-functional perspective, integrating theory from relationship management and brand communications.
Various cases taken from corporate America, including “change communication” for the time of corporate changes, internal communications, corporate social initiatives and other relevant topics will be covered and explored with regards to the significant roles and practices of strategic brand management and corporate communications.
到達目標:
This course focuses on brand management and corporate communication, integral management functions which help building and sustaining relationships with various stakeholder groups for corporate survival in the U.S.
One of the important theme will be the cross functional perspective, integrating theory from relationship management and brand communications.
Various cases taken from corporate America, including “change communications” for the time of corporate changes, internal communications, corporate social initiatives and other relevant topics will be covered and explored the significant roles and practices of strategic brand management and corporate communications.
授業方法: Classes will be conducted online simultaneously and interactively at the designated day and time. Lectures, case analyses and discussions will be planed for this course.We will use LUNA for exchange of documents, and students are expected to submit assignments via LUNA.

第1回: Introduction and Course Overview: Introduction to Corporate America; The Changing Environment for Business; The Importance of Relationship Management in today’s organizations
第2回: Communicating Strategically for Success: American Corporate Communication Strategy Framework; Determining the Communications Objective(s), Target Audience(s) and Key Messages
第3回: The Roots of Corporate Communication: Historical Perspective from PR to Relationship Management in the U.S.
第4回: The Corporate Communication Function: the Organizational Structure for the Function; Subsystems within the Function
第5回: Brand Management Evolution: Origin of Brand in the U.S., Managing Brand Identity, Image, and Reputation- from Vision to Reality
第6回: Corporate Brand: Why do companies care and How they manage It in today’s Corporate America?
第7回: Building Better Relations with Media; How to Manage Traditional and New Media(Online Media) Strategically
第8回: Ethics and Professionalism: Code of Ethics for practitioners; Beyond “Transparency” and “Branding”; The Road to “Authenticity” in the U.S.
第9回: Internal Communications: Employee Engagement and Internal Branding; “Change Communications” during M&A
第10回: Outreach and Communicate: Communicating with the Community and other stakeholder groups; Corporate Responsibility
第11回: Managing Crisis: What is a Crisis?; Crises from the past 30 Years in the U.S.; Communicating during the Crisis
第14回: Wrap up- Management in the U.S.-Strategic Approach to Brand and Corporate Communications: Critical Assignments for practitioners to Move Forward
トピック.授業外学習2: Active participation in class discussions is encouraged.  In order to be able to contribute in class discussions, the students are expected to have read the reading assignments prior to each session.
